Articles.Content:
I remember I has seen a rocket luanch on youtube;on this video,the rocket has 6 SRB:3 of them been lit on the launchpad and the three other one being lit in aire,when the first three SRB has been jettisoned.

My question is:what was that rocket?

I can't remember and ,unfortunately I have deleted My browser history since I have seen the video

Thank you for reading!

Also Pegasus, uses I think 3 SRB stages, Delta II lights 3 of its 9 first stage SRBs in flight, and uses a small SRB for interplanetary boosts, and Antares has a solid 2nd stage.

You could also count the separation motors of every LES used so far.
The Minotaur V in the LADEE thread also uses SRBs as upper stages, and so will Ariane 6.
